snippet: Thirty-five years after Etan Patz’s disappearance in Manhattan, a judge will consider the mental fitness of the confessor, Pedro Hernandez, and will also determine if his Miranda rights were properly issued.
abstract: Justice Michael Wiley will start monthlong hearing to determine whether Pedro Hernandez, who has confessed to killing Etan Patz in 1979, was able to understand his rights when giving his confession to police; his lawyer argues that with an IQ of 70 he did not understand his right to remain silent; hearing will give public rare chance to view videotapes in case and to hear police and prosecutors describe the interrogation.
lead_paragraph: Thirty-five years after Etan Patz’s disappearance in Manhattan, a judge will consider the mental fitness of the confessor, Pedro Hernandez, and will also determine if his Miranda rights were properly issued.

headline.main: Judge to Examine Circumstances of Suspect’s Confession in Patz Case
headline.print_headline: Judge to Examine Circumstances of Suspect’s Confession in Patz Case
